posts.description: A fiery winter sunrise over Mount Rundle in Banff, a sight you just have to see with your own eyes.

If you let curiosity lead the way, the desert will never cease to amaze. @katieboue tops out her lead climb in one of the southwest's many natural wonders. Great climbs and hangs in the Joshua Tree area while working with @clifbar #feedyouradventure #adventureon
Anything can happen, anything can be.

Springtime in the southwest. That beautiful time of year when you can join friends to hike, climb, and explore the warm desert, and then fill the rest of the day with quality time at your camp and around a bonfire. Tall tales, good conversations, and many laughs. Such a great trip earlier this month in the Joshua Tree area partnering with my friends at @clifbar and @theoutbound, refueling between adventures with Clif's new whey protein bars, and passing the time the only way we know how. ‚Äã#feedyouradventure #adventureon 
For more on this adventure, see www.clifbar.com/article/desert-dreaming

The mountain of mountains.
-
A quick reminder that I'll be co-hosting a photography workshop on the WA Coast on May 20th in La Push!
You can still win 1 of 3 free spots by tagging your friends here and tagging #lapushcollabworkshop in a new post of your own today (see my post from 5 days ago). Winners will be selected end of day on Wed, April 26!

The Earth is big and beautiful and full of incredible things. ‚ÄãTake a good look at it today. And tomorrow. And every day after that. #earthday üåé

Big News: I'm stoked to be joining five‚Äã ‚Äãexcellent northwest photographers (tagged above) to co-host a‚Äã huge photography workshop in the La Push area (on the Washington coast) on Saturday, May 20th. For all the details on how to join, see my profile link!

Just a friendly reminder that, one, it's national parks week, and two, that dreams do come true. Even if that dream is to be standing on a mountain top eating a burrito while watching a family of mountain goats frolic in an alpine meadow. True story.

About a thousand feet below the summit, the day's first light hit the windswept, ice-covered crags, and the peak started to glow. It was like a magical castle floating high in the sky, and we stood there at its doorstep looking up. For a moment or more, everything was extraordinary.
Life moves pretty fast. If you don't stop and look around once in a while, you could miss it.

‚ÄãSometimes the path unknown is the path to take. It's officially been two years since I transitioned from my original career into full-time freelance work.  I've always been pretty cautious when it comes to big life decisions, so the move from attorney to creative was a bold one. I have yet to look back, and I feel beyond lucky to be doing what I genuinely love from day to day. One thing I've learned: you can do anything with passion, determination, and the courage to act. Cheers y'all ‚úåüèª

So many mountains, so little time. It would be impossible to capture them all, but wouldn't it be fun to spend a lifetime trying? The north face of Fissile Peak painted in morning light and clouds, perhaps the most dramatic scene I witnessed while in the Whistler area.
It was great to partner with @getolympus this weekend to field test some new weatherproof cameras. With the right camera in hand, it's exciting to see what new doors and adventures you can unlock. ü§òüèª#capturingwhistler

Spending more time outdoors over the last four years than my entire life before has taught me a thing or two. One is that certain places in this world, even when visited many times, can always stop you in your tracks. Further ‚Äãexploring Whistler and testing‚Äã the @getolympus OM-D E-M1 II‚Äã. For this photo I made use of the image stabilization, handholding this long exposure for 1.0 sec, f/14, and ISO 64. #capturingwhistler

This morning's close-up of Black Tusk, a striking pinnacle of rock and ice dominating the Garibaldi range in British Columbia. I've made it to Whistler this weekend to meet both new and old friends, outstanding photographers, to experiment and field test new cameras from @getolympus. Shot this aerial on the new Micro 4/3 OM-D E-M1 II. Excited to learn more while in this incredible environment. #capturingwhistler
